name: Longways set (2 couples)
description: Two-couple longways set. Two couples form two lines of partners facing each other; [P1] on the left and [P2] on the right when facing the band.

name: Longways set (3 couples)
description: Three-couple longways set. Partners face each other in two lines, [P1] on the left and [P2] on the right when facing the band.

name: Longways set (4 couples)
description: Four-couple longways set. Two lines of partners face each other, [P1] on the left and [P2] on the right when facing the band.

name: Longways set (5 couples)
description: Five-couple longways set. Partners face each other in two lines, [P1] on the left and [P2] on the right when facing the band.

name: Longways set (6 couples)
description: Six-couple longways set. Two lines of three couples face each other, [P1] on the left and [P2] on the right when facing the band.

name: Longways set (7 couples)
description: Seven-couple longways set. Partners face each other in two lines, [P1] on the left and [P2] on the right when facing the band.

name: Longways set (8 couples)
description: Eight-couple longways set. Two lines of four couples face each other, [P1] on the left and [P2] on the right when facing the band.

name: Longways set (2–3 couples)
description: Longways set for two or three couples. Partners face each other in two lines, [P1] on the left and [P2] on the right when facing the band.

name: Longways set (3–4 couples)
description: Longways set for three or four couples. Partners face in two lines, [P1] on the left and [P2] on the right when facing the band.

name: Longways set (4–5 couples)
description: Longways set for four or five couples. Partners face in two lines, [P1] on the left and [P2] on the right when facing the band.

name: Longways set (5–6 couples)
description: Longways set for five or six couples. Partners face in two lines, [P1] on the left and [P2] on the right when facing the band.

name: Longways set (4–6 couples)
description: Longways set for four to six couples. Partners face in two lines, [P1] on the left and [P2] on the right when facing the band.

name: Longways set (7–8 couples)
description: Longways set for about seven or eight couples. Two lines of partners face each other, [P1] on the left and [P2] on the right when facing the band. Typically danced like a longways-for-as-many-as-will set but with a finite number of couples.

name: Sicilian circle
description: Groups of two couples face each other, one couple facing clockwise around the room and the other facing anti-clockwise, forming a large circle of these fours which progress to meet new couples.

name: Big Circle of couples
description: Big circle of as many couples as will around the room. Couples face into the middle with [P2] on [P1]’s right.

name: Double circle
description: Dancers form two concentric circles around the room. Usually [P1s] are in the outer circle facing inward and [P2s] are in the inner circle facing outward, with each dancer facing their partner.

name: 2 couples in double circle formation
description: Two couples in double circle formation. Four dancers arranged in two concentric circles, [P1s] in one ring and [P2s] in the other, each dancer facing their partner across the circles.

name: Couples as many as will
description: Any number of couples as many as will, arranged according to the dance, often repeating the same figures all around the room with no fixed set size or fixed set shape.

name: Three-couple circle
description: Three couples in a small circle of six dancers. Several such small circles may be arranged round the room.

name: Four-couple square
description: Four couples on the four sides of a square, all facing the centre; [P1] on the left and [P2] on the right of each pair when facing in.

name: Square set (as many as will)
description: Big square-style set on the four walls of the room, with couples roughly equally spaced along each side and all facing towards the centre. Used when many couples dance square-style figures together.

name: Three facing three
description: Lines of three dancers facing three, arranged round the room. The centre dancer in each line partners the two on either side for figures such as reels of three or similar patterns.
